alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:52AM CDT until April 04 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cedar County in east central Iowa... Scott County in east central Iowa... Muscatine County in east central Iowa... Southwestern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 930 AM CDT. * At 851 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Saulsbury Bridge Campground, or near Muscatine, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Atalissa around 855 AM CDT. Muscatine and Moscow around 900 AM CDT. Wilton and Sweetland Center around 905 AM CDT. Pleasant Prairie and New Era around 910 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Durant, Stockton, Sunbury, Blue Grass, New Liberty, Walcott, Plainview, Camp Liberty, Davenport, Eldridge, Long Grove, Donahue, Dixon, Maysville and Davenport Municipal Airport. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
